intro: Hieracium girerdii, commonly known as the Girerd's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium girerdii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments.
